intro: Barbosella trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed barbosella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves with three distinct lobes. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils near coastal areas. Barbosella trilobata is often found in mangrove swamps and is adapted to brackish water environments.
